Key Match Events: Brock Burke threw a perfect inning of relief against his old team, the Texas Rangers, on Friday night.

Burke allowed an infield hit from Marcus Semien in the eighth, but struck out Wyatt Langford on three pitches, and got Josh Jung to ground into an inning-ending 6-4-3 double play in a 15-pitch eighth inning in the Angels' 5-1 win Friday night.
Pre-Game Insights: Burke joked with injured Rangers slugger Corey Seager that the shortstop was dodging him.
Burke said he was 'excited to face them all. I played with them all the last three or four years.'

Post-Match Reflections: Burke said 'The zero was good enough.'
Burke said he was 'excited to get out there and prove them wrong for DFAing me, and I plan to keep doing that.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burke's turnaround is in part because of a minor alteration the Angels made.

The alteration improved Burke's pitching posture and helped him locate his pitches more effectively by limiting his cross-body motion and preventing him from leaning forward as much during his pitching motion.
Burke said he 'could feel a difference' after making the change, and that it'set me back up to how I felt in 2022.'
Others: Burke was acquired in December 2018 in a three-team trade between the Oakland Athletics, Tampa Bay Rays, and the Rangers.
Burke broke his non-throwing right hand and was on the injured list for the next two months after punching a clubhouse door in Houston in April.
